Reviews.Title: “Descent location but poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: davi d
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in February 2012 and its best quality is it's location. It's in easy distance of the shops, restaurants and transport. However, the photos of this hotel are flattering. The rooms are not spacious or brilliantly lite. The bathroom could do with a good make over especially as the ceiling showed signs of damp penetration and the tiling looked old and knackered. The bedroom was very draughty and the floor felt and looked a little grimy. The staff were friendly enough but, the quality of the service could be improved considerably particularly in the dining area. Breakfast in general was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, with clean spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sly4
Reviews.Content: Found hotel nice and in a great location was really concerned as I'd read all negative comments before we left and was preparing myself for it. But was very happy the rooms were big and clean didn't have a view from the window but wasn't in Barcelona to do that!! Only one fault was the breakfast we ate at a local cafe as I didn't enjoy the hotels.... Overall happy with my stay, not sure what all the fuss was about!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for touring the City, not for business”
Reviews.Author: Drunken_Max
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel whilst on business but will not be using it again. that sounds bad but its just not a good hotel for business travellers. It has no internet connection and the TV is only Spanish channels. The room had no visible aircon either though I am sure there was some system in place. A room facility guide would have been helpful. After all that, the hotel was very clean and the rooms quite well presented. The bathrooms had no wear and tear either. If I was looking for a more economical hotel as a base for visiting Barcelona then this would tick a lot of the boxes. Its well situated and comfortable. One small criticism, the breakfast and especially the coffee in the morning is dreadful but there is a Starbucks which opens at 7:30am nearby, also has 45 minutes of free wifi!

Reviews.Title: “Never again! dark, dingy, sewer smell”
Reviews.Author: 2011NYCTraveler2011
Reviews.Content: This was not my first time in Barcelona (great city!) and I was just stopping for a long weekend on my way to Ibiza so I wasn't looking for anything spectacular. I chose this hotel because of it's location. I wasn't expecting much but this hotel was absolutely awful!! first, the room was the size of a closet with completely illogical room design. The size of the room doesn't matter if there is a good use of space. clearly the designer did not think. I guess they're trying to be eco-friendly or lower their electric bill because there was only sensor lights in the hallways. scary and unsafe!! left in the dark hoping the next light would go on! They also charge extra for an in-room safe (this should be included in the standard price - who doesn't need a safe to put their valuables! annoying to even have it mentioned) In addition, the phone didn't work for external phone calls... since there was only one outlet I couldn't charge my mobile so I wanted to use the hotel phone.. either charge your phone or your camera - take your pick! The biggest turn off was the repulsive sewage odor. I thought I could stick it out since I was only in the hotel for shower and sleep but even that was unbearable due to the stench. It was so bad that I actually checked out early and stayed somewhere else!! As for customer service.. none. Am I bothering you by asking for standard items?? If so, I'll gladly go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4*”
Reviews.Author: Susan L
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, but rooms dark & dismal, not worth the money. Extra bed for child just pushed into what was already a small room, we had to climb over it to get to the bathroom!. Breakfast simple but sufficient. Air conditioning not working when we arrived, temperature was 30 degrees, took three attempts , still wasn't functioning properly when we left .Asked to be moved to another room, was told it was full. Don't be fooled with pictures of bar, didn't open once while we was there, when we asked for a drink we were told, "sorry no staff will not open tonight" that happened every night. If you can book else where we would strongly recommend you do!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Gill F
Reviews.Content: Contrary to what others have wrote we found the hotel clean & efficient, the breakfast plentiful-toast,croissants,yoghurt,cereals,juice,cheese,ham,sausages,bacon,hard boiled eggs,cold meats etc etc-although served a little early for our two teenagers (7.00am-10.30am) and the staff very helpful. The location next to the cathedral in the Barri Gothic is excellent, the tourist information office is at one end of the street (Place de Jaume) & the metro at the other. It is noisy but that is what I would expect from a vibrant city centre. I would recommend it..

Reviews.Title: “Had to change hotel”
Reviews.Author: cityshopper10
Reviews.Content: There was some sort of problem with "water" - the guy in the reseption didn't speak English well - and we had to change to another hotel. The change was taken care of smoothly. The hotel is in excellent location but didn't look like that nice other wise.

Reviews.Title: “good location but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: carolandroy
Reviews.Content: The location was great, close to cathedral, quaint streets and bars, short walk to various key sights. The bathrooms need updating, sink and bath plugs difficult to fit, tiles need regrouting, aircon varible. The cleaning staff were friendly and always passed the time of day. Room cleaned well. The breakfast is not worth the money, even for a contintental breakfast it was not very nice. Coffee machine always on the blink, selection of poor quality cold meats and cheese, friut and orange juice was ok. Save yourself the money and eat across the road,where you can get nice coffee and pastries or at many of the other surrounding bars/cafes for less than you would pay for breakfast at Gotico. Apart from one young man on reception & the cleaners the staff were not very friendly and seemed miserable. Its location is its saving grace. No hotel questionaires were given out and I don't think they read trip advisor as I note these comments have been largely made before. Internet acess expensive at the hotel, only wifi available so u would need your own laptop, hotel ran out of allocation cards. If you need to acess a hotel computer you can't. There is an internet cafe near the picaso museum but it does not open until late morning or mid day, but its cheap and you can use the computers.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, no problems value for money - but not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: somerset94
Reviews.Content: After reading varying reviews about this hotel, but having to book a last minute 2 night stay to visit my son in hospital, I was a little apprehensive. I found the hotel to be very clean, the service was good, the location was excellent. The hotel is old so was shabby in places but painting was being carried out whilst we were there. The only down side was the noisy door system they have to enter your room! Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Girls trip away”
Reviews.Author: chrissiekite33
Reviews.Content: We were moved to this Hotel because our original, Hotel Suizo was overbooked. As it happened this Hotel is 4 star (supposedly) and our previous was only 3. The Hotel is quite nice but not what you would expect for 4 star rating. No TV in the room, no tea/coffee making facilities, no bar facilities. Breakfast was just so with not that much variety, although you could have "bucks fizz". Rooms were clean and bed was comfortable. However, the noise was worse than terrible. It was like trying to sleep in the middle of a roundabout. Having said all of that the loaction was great. So close to shops, great restaurants and Las Ramblas. Reception staff were not that bothered or helpful.

Reviews.Title: “No service! No smiles! No help at all!”
Reviews.Author: OZMARKY
Reviews.Content: Firstl, my apologies for this very late review. Time has slipped away. My partner and I took our first trip to Bercelona, Spain, late December 2010. This place was suggested to us by a travel agent friend here in Oslo, Norway. And all I can honestly say is if you are considering this hotel, do yourselves a great favour......don´t! I´m not sure if this establishment is typical of 4**** Catalanian style customer service (it´s really no more than a high 2 - 3 star venue at best). From the day we arrived until the day we checked we never felt so unwelcome and a hinderence. The only thing that this place has going for it is it amazing location in the Barri Gotic Quarter of this amazing city. The rest of the experience is just a haize of garish decor, lousy customer service, poor facilities, tacky ammenities and NO windows!!!! Not excatly what you would expect from 4****.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel in centric area”
Reviews.Author: esaldana
Reviews.Content: This OK is just ok; it is listed as 4* but it does not have WIFI or Wired Internet; there is no A/C and the room was very hot in January. The staff was very uninterested in their guests. I would not stay here again. The hotel is just ok to me it was most a 2* hotel. The TV was very small and the reception of the channels was very poor

Reviews.Title: “It was OK... good location, but not really 4 star...”
Reviews.Author: El-Yuca-Ingles
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine in my opinion - does not rate international 4 star standard by any means, as the facilities are very limited, but my room was clean, and the location really is very good. The room was an acceptable size, two twin beds, which were very comfortable. Bathroom was fine. There appeared to be very few people staying in the hotel; I more or less did not see anyone else the whole time I was there. Therefore I did not encounter any noise issues; I cannot say how it might have been if the hotel was full. There is no internet service at all, either wired or wireless, free or chargeable, which is surely a requirement for a 4 star? There is a buffet breakfast (I did not try it) and apart from that, no catering available either. Overall, it was OK, I got a reasonable rate through Hotwire (who also bill it as a 4 star property) but since I was expecting 4 star standard, I was a bit disappointed. I would rate it a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: yoyoyoyoyoyo
Reviews.Content: Not so bad. The room was clean, but very small.The view from the window was bad. Staff was friendly. Location is very nice!!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: livin_in_a_dream
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my parents, grandma & brother. I really dont know why majority complain about hotel Gotico, I mean true, it doesn't deserve to be entitled 4 star, but everything was quite satisfactory. (I'd give it maybe 3) The location couldn't have been any better, the rooms were clean & the staff were really friendly. Only problem was the breakfast wasn't too good..but i guess it depends on what you like, each individual has different opinions. I had a small bedroom, but that was ok for me, my parents had a bigger room, it was much better (109). To me, all was fine, since my family & I were out all day. We only needed a place to sleep, shower & eat breakfast. If your like us, out most of the time, I'd recommend Hotel Gotico. However if your looking for something fancy and want to spend your time in the hotel this isn't for you. All in all I'm content, and don't understand most of the other reviews, I was told the hotel was recently renovated, so maybe that's the reason.

Reviews.Title: “Very adequate”
Reviews.Author: DRBennett
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife from July 21th - July 26th, 2010. Regardless of the age or condition of the hotel the location is perfect snd the breakfast was great (enough food to last the day). We had a very clean room with two single beds that we pushed together and a large bath room with a shower and a tub. As I said the place was clean, the food was great,the location was perfect and the staff was very helpful and could all speak english. I recomend the zoo and the double decker bus is a must. I was on this bus for 10 hours one day and was able to see the entire city.

Reviews.Title: “No way is this hotel worth its four stars.”
Reviews.Author: toon54
Reviews.Content: Great location, but this hotel must have bribed the rater to obtain its four stars. We would have rated it at one star - at the most. The staff were indifferent and the facilities in our room were poor, to say the least. The cleaning staff had left a paper cup, which the previous guests had used as an ashtray, on the balcony. This remained there for the whole four days we were there. The bed had certainly seen better days and was very uncomfortable. We couldn't open the fridge because there was no handle on the door and if we had wanted to watch TV, there was only one, rather grainy, channel available.

Reviews.Title: “Save your vacation: avoid Gotico!”
Reviews.Author: GBx4
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gotico can turn a beautiful city into a horrible experience. Dirty, old, dark, noisy, bad service, no hot water, terrible food.......It probably had the four stars it advertises back when it opened, but since then the quality has gone from bad to worse, and from worse to a one-star category hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: jurizzo
Reviews.Content: Small rooms. If you need a space for two bags you won´t find there. All the room have an old things. The bed was noisy. The employees are not polite or attentive, especially one who works at the breakfast. No free wi-fi even at the lobby. The hotel was in reform...a mess!!! The location is good, but too dangerous at night. Finally, Barcelona certainly has a better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever”
Reviews.Author: Carlberg
Reviews.Content: We got the stay, three nights at the hotel, as a wedding gift. We stayed one night and checked in at another hotel, that was one night to much. I must say that we did not really believe the bad reviews this hotel has on tripadvisor, but sadly all of it is true. The location is not worth the hotel rates. You can get a "real" hotel nearby for the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Not American standards.”
Reviews.Author: FOODCRITICDoylestown
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal location, however nothing else is ideal. The rooms are inadequate! They are very old and need updating. There are no amenities and it is rated 4****. There is no alarm clock, tissues, shampoo (packets in foil) broken shower parts, There is no coffee in the room, no fan or air conditioning, no English stations on TV, no internet service in the hotel, breakfast is very moderate. The front rooms are extremely noisy and the back room could either smell foul, be extemely hot or unusually configured. It took us 3 tries to find a room that was somewhat satisfactory, We had to step over dirty linens in the hallway to get to the elevator. The staff was accommodating. It would be fine if the rating was 2**.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE...WORST HOTEL EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: KVG23
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel i have ever stayed in!! The location is the only plus point. When my fiance and I arrived they gave us a twin room instead of the double we had booked, when we asked about this mix up all we got from the staff was attitude. They were rude, ill-mannered and stood there rolling their eyes at us like we were inconveniencing them, when actually if you looked behind the desk they were checking their facebook...hardly what you would expect from a supposed 4 star hotel!!! Don't even bother trying to speak to a manager apparently there isn't one, and the rude reception staff are in charge of the whole hotel!! Do not eat the food, not onnly is it cold and greasy, i witnessed at breakfast one of the servers bring out a fresh tray of food, it had a hair on it. The server saw this and just picked it off and plated up the food...after seeing this i didn't bother going back. Finally if that was not enough to warn you away, then the fact that you will not get any sleep here might it is very very noisy! Dogs barking at all hours, people running through the corridors all in all it was horrendous!!! DO NOT STAY HERE! IT IS HORRIBLE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Goticorroted”
Reviews.Author: mimit712
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the one you should stay away from. Except for the fact of its convenient location that's where it ends. At first site the lobby seems chic boutique, but that all ends when you enter the tiny elevator. When we got to our floor, it was dark, and only lit up with sensor lights. The walls were chipped and decrepid. The #'s on the hotel doors were printed on paper and laminated then glued to the wall. The rooms were mediocre. The beds were not suitable for a dog to sleep on. We had an infestation of ants and the people at the front desk could not speak a word of English. The air conditioning sucked, we were dying from heat, and to top it all we had a huge leak in our bathroom ceiling from the room upstairs. In one word "El Stinko"..ok that's 2. STAY AWAY.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Deanen_Travels
Reviews.Content: Lets see, firstly the worst service experienced in Spain. We went from staying at the Westin in Valencia, which was phenomenal, to staying at a hovel. They claim to be a 4 star establishment, i wouldn't give it a one. The roof caved in just outside our bathroom, the room smelt of dog urine and faeces. Never stay here. I can't understand how Barcelona tourism could even grade this hotel... Pathetic

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Bruno_TL
Reviews.Content: I understand people who don't like Hotel Gotico. My family myself did not. The hotel was ok - the lobby looked better than the other floors; the cleaning products they use smell weird and some rooms are awfully small for 3 people carrying bags. We almost had to leave some stuff outside. But we had a nice balcony from where we could see the nearby Plaça de Sant Jaume and it is perfectly located, just in the Gotic district. Subway is 1 minute away if you want to visit some farther attractions, but the little streets around it are just awesome. The Port Vell, Picasso Museum and the Cathedral are just a walk away, as well. We had a problem which must be told: we noticed some lack of care of the staff regarding our forgotten coats. It seemed that they just did not want to find them, although they were put into some sort of lost and found room. Shipping them turned out to be a problem as well. Other than that, staff was nice and helpful. When in Europe, I don't want more than a basic hotel in a nice location, and this hotel was just fine for my purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: amid_veylisav
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 13.30 and were sitting at the reception until 15.30. Nobody even apologized for that, nobody offered to put our belongings to a locker room. So I assumed that this is normal situation for a staff. We were getting the only answer, - “Your room is not ready”. Eventually, we got the key from room 213. Furniture is very old, room itself smells funny, and that is why cleaning lady uses citrus freshener when she was making up the room, so the smell becomes even funnier. Breakfast is poor; canteen staff mostly came from China and barely speaks English. TV has got only Spanish channels, WI-FI is not available, and if you need a safe you got to pay 2 euros per day. Bar at the reception was always closed. Bathroom towels had holes. Strangely enough but, this 4 star hotel does not offer you a toilet brush, which makes live a bit uncomfortable. Also, bathroom has problem with ventilation that causes humidity in the room. I, really, didn’t enjoy the hotel. My advice is - stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Get new beds!”
Reviews.Author: CathMansour
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated in the Gotico. It does not merit 4 stars however. The beds are so uncomfortable that I had to leave after one night. I asked the staff to add padding when re-making the bed which they did not do so I moved. Otherwise the hotel is super clean, pretty and our room in the back was very quiet Another problem was the antiquated TV that didn't get any english speaking channel, had very poor reception. I asked the front desk to fix the problem of poor reception with no result. there are many new, updated hotels in Barcelona so unless th eGotico steps up and refurbishes I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: dandwDurham
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights, four too many. The room was small, dark, and smelled of drains if we opened the windows. There was no English language channel on the TV (apart from Euro Sport showing skiing). We requested a key for the minibar, but found it didn't fit. The guy in reception used his to open it for us and promised to get us a new one. It never arrived. Well not to worry, the room was not a place to sit around in anyway. In Reception ther is a small bar, but it was almost always closed. When we asked for a drink at reception, we were just informed that the bar was closed. On the one occasion when we did find it open, we asked for a white wine, but they didn't have any. What? No wine? In Spain? The snack bar was always plunged in darkness and unmanned. So nowhere to eat, unable to get a drink, no TV and nowhere pleasant to sit. It didn't help that the waether was cold and wet the whole time, but we can't blame the hotel for that, I suppose. On the positive side, the bathroom was spacious, the breakfasts were fine, and the hotel is in a great position, but we would stay somewhere else another time

Reviews.Title: “crap just about sums it up”
Reviews.Author: Lara_Valseca_King
Reviews.Content: Got moved to this hotel for one night as our hotel (H10 Montcada) had a problem with electricity. They claimed Hotel Gotico was the same, also 4* and with same ammenities etc. Even the reception area was naff in comparison to Motcada. Really dated. When going up to our room, the corridors were dingey, dark and like a rabbit maze! There was renovation being done to the ceiling and outside of our room was plaster and cigarette butts all over the floor and carpets. It was a really awful first impression, and just generally horible. (pics attached) The room itself was horrible, small, dated, dingey, smelly, damp patches on the ceiling and walls, horrible beds and disfunctional air con! When we complained about the dirt and mess and noise outside of our room, they just shrugged and said a cleaner would be up later. It was more like a 2* hotel, and with our last 2 nights in montcada, it was like heaven on earth in comparison, deffinately not equal!

Reviews.Title: “Stay off !”
Reviews.Author: Rytonboyo
Reviews.Content: It says 4 stars but this hotel is real scam. The hotel looked OK from outside as other reviewer says, but as soon as you are in, you'll think "Oh Dear...." The smell was awful, every corner of the building engulfed with the smell of mould. There are 2 lifts and only 1 works. The room was so small and again smells of mould.(Imagine the smell of wet dog !) The ceiling tile was missing so that I could see all wiring and pipes.(Probably not working.) TV set failed to turn on. I can't imagine 4 stars hotel room with 14" TV box. It is much worth than student accomodation. I've never seen/attempted to eat such an awful breakfast in my life. Coffee tasted really awful, I couldn't drink. Every single mug has a crack. Orange juice was definately off. Yoghurt was 2 days after the best before date. Sausage was off and Apple wasn't fresh, in fact, it was cooking apple. You need to speak Mandarin if you want make a complain to waiter/waitress. Don't even tempted to make a complain at the reception. They don't care. I haven't seen a rat in the hotel, probably even rat won't stay this place. People says, the location is great but so does any other hotel. Just leave it !

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Iakinthos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week and it was a really bad experience. The first thing that makes you never want to enter that place again was an awful smell on the whole floor where our room was located. There were no windows and no ventilation in the corridor so the smell was disgusting. Whenever exiting the elevator (only one of the two was working) we had to hold our noses. Imagine returning from a nice romantic dinner and just before entering your room, having to breath the smell of mould first. No. 2 Unacceptable thing was the BLOCKED bath tub. It took 20 minutes to drain due to being very blocked and while taking a shower we had to step in the blocked water. Moreover, the rooms need renovation! The furniture, the curtains and the floor make the atmosphere too depressive. It is supposed to be a 4 star hotel and they don't even have contemporary mattresses, instead they use simple white sheets that were never changed during our stay, a thin blanket on top and some cheap filthy bed covers! Most of the TV channels were not functioning. The room was on the front side of the hotel and was extremely noisy. We could hear people shouting in the street and ambulances passing by until early morning hours. Coffee at breakfast is awful. We found hair on top of some cookies one morning but nobody from the waiters ever noticed. The Front Office Staff are polite but don't expect to get much of information as a Tourist from them. The Maids are really polite, always smiling. Definitely not a 4 star hotel. The only positive thing is the location as it is central and just accross the Jaume Train Station.

Reviews.Title: “Not the 4* it claims to be”
Reviews.Author: Butterfly1978
Reviews.Content: We were booked to stay at another Group Gargallo hotel, The Suizo, just down the road but were moved to the Gotico due to problems with the top floor of the Suizo. The Suizo Hotel is a 3* hotel and we've stayed there before. It is not the best hotel, but as it's a 3*, and having stayed there before, we knew what to expect. We re-booked it because of it's location, and it was clean and very cheap. When we were moved to the Gotico we got quite excited - a 4* hotel and we'd only paid for a 3*, what a result ! From the outside, and even in reception the hotel looked good. We couldn't wait to get up to our room, but we quickly realized it was actually no better than the Suizo Hotel we had originally booked. Our room was very small, a twin room when we had booked a double. The view was of some kind of shaft, no natural daylight at all. The ceiling tiles were falling down in the bathroom and my husband couldn't even stand up properly in the shower, he had to bend right over just to get underneath it, it was that small. The rooms were also very noisy, we could hear everything going on in the room next door from every little cough and sneeze to the toilet flushing and the shower running. The only plus point about this hotel is the location, you cannot beat it. Just a very short walk from the Cathedral, a nice easy stroll from La Ramblas and the beach, and lots of lovely coffee shops, bars and tapas restaurants just along the road. If we had paid the full price of this hotel we would have been very disappointed. We would rather pay for the 3* and know what to expect, than pay more money for this hotel and get the same, if not a lower standard than a 3* This hotel is defiantly not the 4* hotel is claims to be.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - that is about it.”
Reviews.Author: MoMoCh
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at this hotel. It was a package deal with our cruise leaving from Barcelona. We could only choose 2 hotels - either the Gotico or a hotel just outside of the city and since I wanted a hotel that was centrally located - I chose the Gotico. I agree with all the other people that have posted on this site for this hotel - NOT a 4 star hotel by any means. 2 stars at the most. I will also agree that the location is wonderful. Close to the metro and in walking distance to many places including Ramblas. The gothic quarter of Barcelona where this hotel is located is a wonderful place to explore. I will also say that the room was clean and the bathroom was the best part of the room but that is about it. The room was so small - in fact it was actually smaller than my room on my cruise ship. The window opened up into a back alley and the a/c was so loud we thought that the actual unit was in the room. They put us right across from the elevators and one was broken on our floor so every time someone buzzed the elevator, the broken one kept opening and closing. We finally got fed up and called the front desk and told them to either fix the elevator or move us to another room - miraculously, the elevator was fixed. There is a breakfast buffet in the morning and most of the European people enjoyed it - there were very few things that we ate - mostly the breads and cheeses. The meats (specifically the pork products) didn't even looked cooked and most of the time, the eggs were already cold. Thankfully we only stayed in this hotel for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: darylsdaughter
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were given a twin bedded room even though we had booked a double (it was our first holiday away together and this was pretty important to us!!). We complained at reception and were moved to a double room. An hour later, when we were both changing, a member of staff used a key card to unlock our door and walked in on us. He didn't apologise but just turned and walked straight out again. The room was clean, but very dark and the view from the window was of a neighboring wall. We had to get replacement key cards at least ten times during our seven day stay because they weren't working, but the staff never once apologised or offered an explanation. On more than one occasion when we returned to the hotel after a night out there would be a crowd of us waiting outside to be let in by the reception staff, who would eventually appear then walk nonchalantly over and open the doors without a word. When we were going to leave I asked the reception to book us a taxi to the airport for the following day; I checked later on that this had been done. As it turned out it wasn't done and I had to actually YELL at the receptionist before he would pick up the phone and actually order us one. Barcelona was lovely (we're actually returning this year for our honeymoon), but there is no way on earth I'd ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - small but clean”
Reviews.Author: jen1888
Reviews.Content: Did not actually book this hotel but was sent here when another hotel gave away our room. The hotel is ok. Our room was small but clean - which was fine as we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. Breakfasts were fine. We mentioned that the lighting in the corridor wasn't working and it was fixed promptly. Location was quite good - in the gothic area, near underground station.

Reviews.Title: “2 Star at best!”
Reviews.Author: OriginalSparky
Reviews.Content: The only positive thing about this hotel is it's location which is excellent. The room which was situated at the back of the hotel had a real strong sewerage smell. We had to purchase lots of air refreshners from the local supermarket to compensate for the bad odour. The room was situated over a back yard which seemed to be used for doing the hotel laundry. You could hear the washing machine being used at various times. We found the room very dull and dreary, certainly not somewhere to relax after a hard day's sightseeing. There were no tea/coffee making facilities and the TV had about 5 channels which actually worked. The buffet breakfast was very average with very little choice. They kept running out of breakfast juice, even at 8:00am. I certainly would not recommend this hotel to anyone. It does not merit its 4 Stars.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel consumed by obvious decay”
Reviews.Author: Raymondas
Reviews.Content: It looks as though this once was a nice modern hotel. But obviously it lacks proper care and maintenance. Most of the staff is indifferent to visitors - guys at the reception seldom take pains to say hello when you pass through the lobby. The room we were staying was smoked through and steady tobacco smell stuck to our belongings. Mini bar is locked, safe is locked - you have to pay extra for them. TV set shuts down as soon as you turn the bedside lamp off, therefore you need to keep the light shining if you want to watch TV. Bathroom facilities are obsolete and barely functioning. Location is absolutely unbeatable but for me this only reason isn't good enough to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location - suitable for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: westernranger
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights whilst awaiting a cruise ship. Excellent location with the Metro station almost directly outside. Room was average but clean with a comfortable bed. Breakfast was good with a reasonable selection and overall the hotel was good value for the money paid for the time you would expect to spend in it when visiting Barcelona. Taxis constantly pass outside the front door but the reception desk will order one for you if you want. Beware of this however as the driver adds about another €3 ! Reception will keep your luggage after check-out until you are ready to depart. Always try a few words in Spanish - it is appreciated and you will then find everyone very helpful as opposed to expecting the Spanish just to speak English...or judging by the negative comments on here....American ????

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, BUT...”
Reviews.Author: gshamis
Reviews.Content: Location is great, walking distance from everything. Room was ok, slightly unusual layout and 2 steps in the room to go from bed to bath -- u might trip in the dark. Room was VERY clean although some hallways were dirty and some ceilings in hallways leaked. Locks are rather outdated, and using a keycard was kinda painfull Breakfast was included, but it's not at all healthy and some items we thought should be warm were cold. We were also disappointed with their safe -- it needs a key which you pay 2E/day and u have to carry key with you Another disappointment was promise of internet. There is NO WiFi pickup in the room, and when I asked they told me only in the lobby, which is NOT accomodating for the purpose. And it's NOT provided by hotel -- rather by local phone carrier Telefonica which charges what I thought unreasonable rates/terms

Reviews.Title: “Normal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miguel1979
Reviews.Content: Low budget hotel; Normal/Low quality rooms; Good cleaning; A normal city hotel; I would recomend as everyone that goes to Barcelona, will expect to pass all day out of the hotel, only going there to rest and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Gotico Hotel in Barcelonal, Spain”
Reviews.Author: kidslearntoread
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel in the a.m. not knowing that the check in time was 1:00. Keep in mind we had jet lag from Orlando, Florida to Barcelona, Spain. The manager at the front desk was not a nice man. He barely looked at us and had an I don't care attitude about the whole problem. We were allowed to check the luggage in but had to sit around or walk the streets barely keeping our eyes open and wait for the check in time. We just wanted to sleep. When we finally got our room, it was very small for a 4 star room. The television did not work very well and the water pressure in the shower was terrible and horrible!!!! The shower nozzle kept on falling. The room was clean but it smelled musty. We had a balcony which overlooked the city but in order to do it, you had to stand on a scary foot stool in order to see down in the streets. The manager was not at all helpful with taxi information or any other questions about the city. He rarely smiled. Breakfast: The orange juice was full of pulp. It was wonderful. Breakfast was continental style. The coffee was terrible. They had yogurt, bread, sausages, milk, pastries, strange kind of cured meat and a goat flavored type cheese. The cream for the coffee was steaming hot and they had cold milk for the cereal box choices. The sausage was not very good and the eggs were cold. They had a toaster for the toast with jellies. Eating area was very clean....the service was good. The lobby should be smoke free but was not...we had to get used to everyone smoking everywhere. Also found out that dogs were allowed...gross! Didn't see any in the hotel though...no barking either. When we were ready to leave, we asked the front desk about the taxi to take us to the cruise ships. The manager again was not concerned about giving us any information. Too busy looking down at his paperwork....rude.... We had to ask many times for a copy of our paperwork for our files. We ended up walking with our luggage to the cruise ship because the taxi service people were fibbing about it being a holiday. It wasn't a holiday, it was just a Saturday and they wanted to charge an arm and a leg. The front desk could have given us this information. We had to find out about walking several blocks from a near-by store that spoke english. Another lady was crying about her room being filthy and smelly and they also woke her up at 7:00 , barging in without knocking to clean the room and the wake up call was for 11:00 and not 7:00. She was sleeping when they came in and woke her up and scared her. The manager was not trying to fix the problem and it was like ,,,"oh well, deal with it." type attitude. The manager asked if she wanted her money back she just wanted to sleep and get moved to another room ...but he wouldn't move her saying the place was full when it was clearly not a full hotel. He said the only rooms available were the suites which would cost her more money. She was very upset. The bar area was never open. If this is supposed to be a 4 star hotel, where is the pool and all of the other things that go with a 4 star hotel. We spoke to someone who went to the Hilton and the Sheriton in Barcelona that was a 4 star and was FANTASTIC and cheaper. The beds were hard and uncomfortable. The manager can be seen in their brochure at the front desk on the left side. Kind of balding with glasses. His assistants were very nice and tried to make up for the manager's attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Place!”
Reviews.Author: mfcubana
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a 3.5 or 4 star hotel by any stretch of the imagination. It is possibly a 2 star, and that is being kind to it. The place is dirty, unkept, hallways have holes in the wall and the rooms are dark, dingy and noisy. It was so bad we stayed for 2 hours and checked out even thought we had pre-paid our stay. The location is good, but other than that there is nothing good to say about it. There are far too many other good hotels in Barcelona to stay at this dump!

Reviews.Title: “OK But Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: Scot in America
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Gotico is not a bad place, but it is far, far, from a 4-Star hotel. We stayed a true 5-star hotel in Madrid -- the Westin Palace -- and the Gotico is at least two and possibly three levels below that. We ended up there because the nights we were in Barcelona were the festival for the longest days (and shortest nights) of the year, and thus all of the hotels in our books were booked solid. We would not stay there again. The hotel has the ambiance of the places I used to frequent when I used "Let's Go" to bum around Europe in the 1980s -- diffident front desk staff smoking cigarettes while at work; dark hallways; tiny rooms with sagging narrow beds; a depressing bar and restaurant area, tiny bars of soap, and serviceable but dank-feeling bathrooms. The one huge plus is the location, which is one of the best in the city. The hotel is about a block directly south of the cathedral, which places it directly in the center of the tourist sights -- Las Ramblas to the west, the gothic quarter and the beaches to the south, La Ribera to the east, and fashionable residential areas to the north.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and positive experience...”
Reviews.Author: CPH_DK
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews of the hotel on this site AFTER booking the room and got a bit worried... but for no reason as it turned out... We arrived late (2am) and immediately felt expected by the young english speaking night porter, who had us checked into our room in about 5 minutes. After checking the nice room (even though it's window were facing the back court/roof of the breakfast restaurant) the night porter willingly directed us to an open sandwich bar in the nearby neighbourhood and gave us the key to the in-room minibar. It's true that the hotel/the room seemed a little worn down, and it's true that it's not what I would consider a true 4 star hotel. But more importantly the room was very clean and between the two nights we stayed there the beds were made, towels changed and so on. We were not disturbed by the nearby cathedral's tolling bells, the tv worked very well, the lights worked very well. We had a nice little area with a desk, two chairs and a little table, the beds were comfortable and spacious, the few questions we had at the reception desk were all readily answered in english (not perfect english, but the attempt and effort was certainly made), we had no problems checking out and so on and so on... Breakfast was not included in our price, so I can't comment on that. We had no need for the A/C in the room, but it was there. The "A/C" in the bathroom was a bit noisy, but turned off with the light, so it was a very little nuisance. Location is EXCELLENT for exploring the wonderful city. Also, lots of restaurants, cafés, "supermarkets" and other shops nearby. We really enjoyed our stay, and I will have no problem at all returning to the hotel (maybe next time we'll find something a little cheaper, as we didn't spend much time in the room). We walked from the bus station to the hotel in the middle of the night, and didn't feel unsafe at all - actually, there were hardly any people on the streets at all. Also, we returned home late at night after a busy day in the town, and then just avoided the small narrow streets in the area (explore them during the day, it's really worth it), and kept to the larger ones... As you can see by now, I find it very difficult to say anything negative about the city or the hotel... GO THERE... :o)

Reviews.Title: “Bello Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: PortsmouthTravelbug
Reviews.Content: What a great city ...and the Hotel Gotico suited our needs perfectly! Situated in the old town it was in an ideal location, close to the Jaume Metro station and literally within walking distance of the Cathedral and other museums. The reception staff were polite and answered any questions we had to ask. There was a fairly comfortable reception area and a small bar that we used once. There was also another seating area on the first floor although we didn't use it. Our room 106 was good...on the first floor overlooking the street so there was some noise but nothing too bad. We like bustling cities.It was clean, with comfortable single beds and the bathroom was spacious with twin washbasins and a jacuzzi bath. No hint at all of the drains mentioned in previous reviews! The breakfasts were good too. Plenty of choice...all the usual continental fare plus bacon,eggs and a toasting machine. The staff were efficient and kept the food topped up. Our only criticism would be the noise...mainly from the other guests scrapping their chairs back on the tiled floor. Perhaps we are used to a gentler start to the day? As for eating out in the evening we found an excellent restaurant,Cafe de l'Academia, just 2 minutes around the corner in Carrer Lledo. It is only open at 8.45pm from Monday to Friday and judging by the full tables I think it would be best to book. We enjoyed 2 delicious meals there at a reasonable price. And now for Barcelona! What a great place for a city break. Must see places are obviously the Sagrada Familia. Nothing had quite prepared us for this visit. I had read up a bit before hand but hadn't quite grasped the sheer scale of this project....what had already been built and how much there was still to complete. One majestic building site! Get there early....the queues built up over the day. Guell Park was interesting too, another testimony to the genius of Gaudi, although be prepared for a steep walk uphill from the Metro station. We also really enjoyed our visit to Musee Picasso, a wonderful collecton of some of his early work as well as the later styles that he became famous for. I could go on and on...... but I won't. Needless to say we will be going back to visit some of the things we missed, to revisit those we really enjoyed and we would definitley use the Gotico again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room but not much else”
Reviews.Author: RachelCov
Reviews.Content: Myself and 4 friends booked this city break for our 40th birthdays and from the previous reviews were a little worried about what we might expect. To be honest, they are all accurate! Good points: Great location - Hotel Gotico is about a 10 minute walk from Las Ramblas and surrounded by great restaurants and shops. You could not wish for a better location. As there were 5 of us we were given a twin and triple room. The twin room was quite small but our room was huge (I think there're some photos of our room earlier on in this thread) and consisted of a twin room, separate single bedroom a bathroom and separate toilet. Clean - The room was extremely clean and the maids did a great job of servicing the rooms. The beds were made daily and fresh towels (which unfortunately had seen better days) were supplied. Breakfast - the breakfast (although typically continental) was more than adequate and on the final day we found some bacon and sausage which we hadn't spotted before. Not so good points: As stated by so many other reviewers, the hotel is definately not 4 star. It does not offer any facilities other than bed and breakfast and even though there is a bar in the reception area we never saw it open. We did enquire when it opened and were told "in the morning" but we never saw it open then either. It was frustrating that outside of breakfast time you could not even get a cup of coffee. Our rooms were on the back of the hotel. As they had no proper windows (ours looked out onto a ventilation shaft and the laundry area), it was very dark. As stated in the previous couple of reviews there was an awful drain smell, in our room made worse each time we flushed the toilet, to the point that we had to warn each other when we flushed the loo so we all prepared for the smell. However, you tend to become more immune to it as time goes on. The staff were ok and answered our questions, ordered taxis etc but they were not particularly friendly, rarely smiled and everything seemed like too much effort. In summary, Hotel Gotico is great if you just want a place to rest your head at night. There are plenty of restaurants, bars, cafes within walking distance so is ideal if you don't want to spend much time in your hotel, which in all honesty you shouldn't wish to do in a city like Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel not very good.”
Reviews.Author: cranial
Reviews.Content: Booked a 4* thinking it would be lovely - but we were wrong. Hotel staff really unfriendly, generally smelt of drains, breakfast appalling (had to point out the out of date yoghurts to staff). Should really be rated a 2*. Apart from that the location was spot on and Barcelona is a fantastic place to visit. Recommend the tour bus and trip up the Gaudi temple.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Poochpeg
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel before I read the reviews and was really worried that I had made a mistake. We found the hotel to be in a brilliant location - less than 5 min walk from La Ramblas, surrounded by really good restaurants that seemed to cater for all tastes and budgets. As regards the hotel itself, it was really nice. Reception staff were polite and helpful any time we spoke to them. As for our street facing room, it was spotlessly clean. The shower worked well and the bathroom was also really clean. I will definitely stay here again when I return to Barcelona and have no problem recommending it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: AdventureGuru
Reviews.Content: I honesty don't know how this hotel has received 3.5 stars. There must be a different system than North America. This hotel was atrocious. The room was dingy and dark. There was mold and rust in the bathtub. The mattress was creaky and worn out. The front desk staff was rude and obnoxious. I asked for a breakfast restaurant recommendation and the guy working the front desk responded rudely saying there were lots of places around while waving his hand in a dismissive gesture like I was just a stupid tourist. To think that I paid $180 a night for this place really upsets me. The only bright spot was the very friendly maid who took time out to speak to me in Spanish and ask me how my vacation was going. She was great. But, this place should be avoided! I checked out the next day and found a very nice hotel called Hotel Axel. It caters mostly to gay clientele but bills itself as hetero-friendly. Not only were the rooms much nicer, cleaner, bright, well-appointed, etc but free bottled (as much as you want) was offered, along with a very friendly staff. It's only a 10 minute walk to the Gothic Quarter, but well worth the stroll. It's in a much less congested area and you won't get the tourist be damned attitude that was evident in the Hotel Gotico.

Reviews.Title: “Great loction, bad service”
Reviews.Author: Wissing
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in Barcelona and stayed at Hotel Gotico. The location was great, but the service was poor. To check in, we had to wait 2 hours. We had asked for a nice room with balcony and a king size bed, but the room we got didn't have a balcony and neither a window!!! After we had spoke to the reception we got a room with windows but no balcony and two single beds. The room was quite big and clean, but the breakfast was poor. We can't agree that the Hotel Gotico it a four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can be better! Service not good!”
Reviews.Author: bigbenj
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed in this hotel for 3 nights less than 2 weeks ago. If you are after the location then this is a good choice, since it is walking distance from La Rambla, and other touristic places. However the service is not so good, especially the person manning the reception desk during the days when we were there. He was not smiling, was not interested to answer our questions (as if we were a big burden to him). I wouldn't recommend staying here since there are so many hotels in the Gothic quarter. The other thing that i found lacking was even though there was a Wifi hotspot (Telefonica) in the hotel, they were not selling the prepaid cards to guests who want to avail of the service. They probably do not have many businessmen staying in the hotel. When i asked about this, they said the internet connection in the bar was free, but when i tried it several times it was not. They don't even know! I have brought my laptop with me during business trips and this is the only time i was not able to buy a prepaid internet card from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Perfect setting to visit the oldest area in Barcelona. The room we had was comfortable but the bathroom would have benefited from better towels. The hotel lacks a lounge area but has a small bar, however this lacks proper staff and, whilst we were there, had no bottle opener ! On the whole clean and good value for money with an adequate breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm, not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Catmoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gotico Hotel for 4 nights in January 2006. We had never been to Barcelona before and were looking forward to it. It was our 10th wedding anniversary and I had asked for an especially nice room prior to our stay. When we got there the room had twin beds and a really musty drain type smell. We stuck with it for the first night but asked to be moved to a room with a double bed (as requested on booking the hotel). We moved rooms the next day but this 2nd room was a lot smaller and the bathroom wasn't big enough to swing a cat! Again, there was a bad drains smell and the taps were falling off the wall in the bath. At least the first room was twice the size and had a bigger bathroom with taps that were in one piece. The hotel was in a fantastic location and it really was a shame that the hotel was dreadful. The breakfasts weren't much to shout about either and the tv in both rooms we stayed in only received foreign channels which we couldn't understand. When we asked at reception about the channels they sent someone up to look at them who played around with the remote for a while and then just said "it doesn't work" sorry. In general, good location, great city but rubbish hotel. I wouldn't recommend it at all. Maybe we had been spoilt in the past having stayed in some fabulous hotels including Dubai, Copenhagen, Hong Kong and many more. I am not sure where in the Gothic quarter of Barcelona has a good hotel to be honest, they all looked the same!
